title: A Complete Guide to Unjailbreaking an iPhone

steps.title: Plug the iPhone into your computer.
steps.content: Plug the iPhone into your computer. Use a lightning USB cable to plug it in. [1] X Expert Source Luigi Oppido Computer & Tech Specialist Expert Interview. 24 March 2021

steps.title: Press and hold the Home and Power button for 10 seconds.
steps.content: Press and hold the Home and Power button for 10 seconds. Release the Power button after 10 seconds.

steps.title: Hold the Home button for an additional 5 seconds.
steps.content: Hold the Home button for an additional 5 seconds. You should see a "Connect to iTunes" screen appear.

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK . Doing so will confirm that you want to restore a device that's in recovery mode. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Click Restore and Update.
steps.content: Click Restore and Update . iTunes will begin restoring your device. [3] X Expert Source Luigi Oppido Computer & Tech Specialist Expert Interview. 24 March 2021 This process may take several minutes to complete. Do not unplug the device during the restore process.

steps.title: Click "Restore from this backup:"
steps.content: Click "Restore from this backup:" Click "Set up as new iPhone" to start fresh.

steps.title: Select the backup from the drop down.
steps.content: Select the backup from the drop down.

steps.title: Click Continue.
steps.content: Click Continue . iTunes will set up your device. This process may take a few minutes.

steps.title: Complete the setup on your iPhone.
steps.content: Complete the setup on your iPhone. Tap to follow the on-screen prompts.Your iPhone will be restored to its "unjailbroken" state, and all the content and files you had on your jailbroken iPhone will be removed.
